name: Greek Watermelon Pizza
author: Katherine Martinelli
summary: The sweet-salty combination of watermelon, feta cheese, olives, tomatoes, and mint might sound strange but once you've tried it you'll be convinced. A perfect summer appetizer or even light lunch, this Greek watermelon pizza looks beautiful, is a little different, and couldn't be easier to make.
ingredients: 1  center-cut slice of watermelon, about 1 inch thick
1 tablespoon Kalamata olives, pitted and finely chopped
directions: Cut the round watermelon slice into 6 to 8 wedges, but keep them arranged into a circle
Sprinkle feta cheese, tomato, olives, and mint evenly over the watermelon
